commit.message:
Support shm key and drm for rawfb option

This will support both x11 and Wayland. (#227)

* Add support shm key for rawfb option

Sometime shmid is not same on different time or system, we should use a constant ID for shm. Here use shm key to instead.

* Add DRM support

access GPU with DRM, this will support x11 and wayland

* Fix a bug for shmget params.

shmget should be 0 otherwise it would alloc a new shared memory but not for the frame buffer.

* fix drm configure while compiling.

verification.payload:
tree 6067c7292e2ff3336880301142a70a763986fd45
parent 354602cffa8edcbe813da6dfd051b96d94b3efbc
author Linex <26711215+linex-cd@users.noreply.github.com> 1690887204 +0800
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1690887204 +0200

Support shm key and drm for rawfb option

This will support both x11 and Wayland. (#227)

* Add support shm key for rawfb option

Sometime shmid is not same on different time or system, we should use a constant ID for shm. Here use shm key to instead.

* Add DRM support

access GPU with DRM, this will support x11 and wayland

* Fix a bug for shmget params.

shmget should be 0 otherwise it would alloc a new shared memory but not for the frame buffer.

* fix drm configure while compiling.

commit.message:
Fix building w/ libreSSL 

When building x11vnc with LibreSSL the build fails with undefined
references for SSL_CTX_set_security_level which is currently only
available with OpenSSL. This can be fixed by disabling the code as
is already done for OpenSSL versions older than 1.1.0.

This builds with LibreSSL 3.5.x.

verification.payload:
tree 6c1d6d670928ed58ec5f4aa42cebda7c0bd1a47e
parent 7388e4acfa906d2adaf8d0caf036ee1d2059c974
author orbea <orbea@riseup.net> 1657051950 -0700
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1657051950 +0200

Fix building w/ libreSSL 

When building x11vnc with LibreSSL the build fails with undefined
references for SSL_CTX_set_security_level which is currently only
available with OpenSSL. This can be fixed by disabling the code as
is already done for OpenSSL versions older than 1.1.0.

This builds with LibreSSL 3.5.x.

commit.message: Fix potential multiplication overflows
Fix allocation length for sslpeer unix username

Refactor README.md

Fix README.md's Markdown formatting and split it into separate files
based on their original www.karlrunge.com contents & locations.

Changes:
* Remove old/broken www.karlrunge.com links
* Move 'Chaining SSH's' section into 'How to use x11vnc'
* Remove 'Beta Testing'/changelog section
* Move FAQ section into doc/FAQ.md
* Move 'Misc. build problems' section into 'Building x11vnc'
* Move 'Sun Ray Notes' into doc/SUNRAY.md
* Move 'Notes on x11vnc SSL Certificates and Key Management' into
  doc/SSL.md
* Move 'Using Apache as an SSL Gateway to multiple x11vnc servers
  inside a firewall' into doc/SSL-PORTAL.md
* Move 'Enhanced TightVNC Viewer (SSVNC: SSL/SSH VNC viewer)' into
  doc/SSVNC.md
* Move x11vnc options dump into doc/OPTIONS.md

Fixes #137

commit.message:
Use linux/videodev2.h header file if available

Unlike the original linux/videodev.h header, the replacement
libv4l1-videodev.h header does not automatically include
linux/videodev2.h.

Signed-off-by: Michael Brown <mbrown@fensystems.co.uk>

Use libv4l1-videodev.h replacement header file if available

The linux/videodev.h header was removed in kernel 2.6.38.  A drop-in
replacement header is available from libv4l as libv4l1-videodev.h.

Signed-off-by: Michael Brown <mbrown@fensystems.co.uk>

Fix manpage acute accents

Closes #150

commit.message:
use a clearer error message clearer when your password is too long

Consider the password '12345678901234567890123456789012' which is 32 bytes.

Prior to this commit, you could use `x11vnc -storepasswd file` and you would
see a prompt to enter that password. When you type it in and press enter,
the prompt would turn into:
```
Enter VNC password:
Verify password:
** passwords differ.
```

The reason is related to the length of the buffer and `fgets()` is kinda
broken. It doesn't tell you that there's too many characters. But it does
leave the newline from pressing enter on input. So that gets checked for,
and if it's not there then it's assumed the password was too long.

The new output is:
```
Enter VNC password:
Verify password:
** password exceeds maximum 30 characters.
```

This makes it clearer to the user how to solve the problem.

verification.payload:
tree b9e48ebd84d7aedba7494a82d053e41898547d66
parent 87cd0530f438372dda3c70bb491a6fd19f09acc2
author Keith Bennett <inetknght@knightoftheinter.net> 1598735213 -0500
committer Keith Bennett <inetknght@knightoftheinter.net> 1598735213 -0500

use a clearer error message clearer when your password is too long

Consider the password '12345678901234567890123456789012' which is 32 bytes.

Prior to this commit, you could use `x11vnc -storepasswd file` and you would
see a prompt to enter that password. When you type it in and press enter,
the prompt would turn into:
```
Enter VNC password:
Verify password:
** passwords differ.
```

The reason is related to the length of the buffer and `fgets()` is kinda
broken. It doesn't tell you that there's too many characters. But it does
leave the newline from pressing enter on input. So that gets checked for,
and if it's not there then it's assumed the password was too long.

The new output is:
```
Enter VNC password:
Verify password:
** password exceeds maximum 30 characters.
```

This makes it clearer to the user how to solve the problem.

commit.message:
src/sslhelper: fix tls handshake failed error w/ OpenSSL 1.1.x

x11vnc server uses ADH based ciphersuites which are not available
in the default security level in OpenSSL 1.1.1, causes tls handshake
failed error.

lowered the ADH security level from"ADH:@STRENGTH to ADH:@SECLEVEL=0

This fixes : TLS Handshake failed error w/ OpenSSL 1.1.x #129

commit.message:
Experimental support for double buffered fb

Adds optional suffix to rawfb string that will enable x11vnc to map the virtual
size specified, not just screen size. x11vnc will then track yoffset of fb as it
scans for changes as this specifies which part of the fb is actually being
displayed.
